programme.title: Britain's War of Thrones: The Hundred Years War, with Dan Jones
programme.desc: The historian and writer documents the turbulent conflicts between the French royal houses of Valois and Burgundy, and their Plantagenet rivals in England, which exploded with such ferociousness in the colossal struggle of The Hundred Years War, forging the history of medieval and early modern Europe.

programme.title: Pirate Traders
programme.desc: Tony gets a heads-up about a King Air chopper available for a steal of a price. However, things look suspicious when the team goes to meet the seller.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Paul tries to persuade his son that they should purchase lockers with an odd number after a lucky poker win, and Ursula buddies up with her pet chinchilla.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Tensions among the buyers are at an all-time high, with the stress of competition on the auction circuit and the buyers facing major decisions with new business ventures.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Matt relocates crocodiles from a cattle ranch in an area rich in iron ore, where the animals are proving a danger to miners.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Matt and the team head to two outback ranches with some serious croc problems, including one where no one dares go near the river.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz search for valuable antiques in a barn despite an ominous warning.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Theorists ask whether a currently unidentified species represented in human DNA could be a result of breeding between man and alien in the distant past.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Expert investigations into the possibility that reptilian aliens are more than a pop-culture creation and a favourite of works of science-fiction.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: After facing a hostile reception at an auction in New Jersey, Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a 1960s skeet-throwing machine and an antique carriage.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys find a rifle with a matching cutlass bayonet, as well as a bowling pin-setter, at an auction in California and hope to strike a deal that will result in a profit.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones uncover a Swedish rifle and a golf ball retriever, and try to sell them at an auction in Panorama City.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: At a storage unit sale in Riverside, Ton Jones breaks the rules of auction hunting to take on a rival with shady bidding tactics.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones enter a bidding war for promising-looking storage units, but the ice-resurfacing machine they discover may not be as valuable as anticipated.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a high-powered amateur rocket and a piece of machinery used for mining gold at a storage unit in Littleton, Colorado.

programme.title: Irish Pickers
programme.desc: Ian is on the search for a very special antique for a friend and contact in the US â€“ celebrity tattooist Mark Mahoney â€“ whose clients include Johnny Depp and Angelina Jolie.

programme.title: Pirate Treasure of the Knights Templar
programme.desc: The trail leads to India where Barry Clifford checks out an island that may contain the most fabled Templar treasure - the Flaming Cross of Goa.

programme.title: Pirate Treasure of the Knights Templar
programme.desc: Barry Clifford takes a final shot at digging up lost Templar treasure, while Scott Wolter uncovers an important relic that may be a link to the Templar-Pirate connection.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team considers buying a mysterious 17th-century treasure chest that no one has yet managed to open.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers deal with the most expensive item they have ever appraised, while Rick assesses a 1948 electric shock therapy machine and an off-road vehicle.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers investigate a huge gold bar thought to be from a 14th-century shipwreck, and consider a collection of baseball memorabilia in mint condition.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The work of Richard Harrison, his son Rick and grandson Corey at their pawn shop on the outskirts of Las Vegas, as they interact with their staff and assess the true value of items brought in to their store by customers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A look at some of the rarest items in the shop's history, including a 1969 Beach Bomb Prototype Hot Wheel and a Star Wars Boba Fett action figure.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Some of the priciest items in the pawn shop's history, including a $70,000 Panama Pacific gold coin from 1915.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: In the Second World War, Suffolk was home to 32 airfields that served as stations for US bombers. Suggs and Stephen hunt for relics of the visiting aircraft.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: Madness frontman Suggs and militaria expert Stephen Taylor bring forgotten stories of the Second World War back to life by unearthing artefacts from former military sites across the UK. Here, the duo look for relics of the 1944 D-Day operation.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff is late to the auction, leaving Ton Jones to bid for a bow-and-arrow set and a flame-thrower by himself.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The competition is tough in Ton Jones's home town of Antelope Valley, California, where the guys manage to pick up two cheap units.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter: Most Wanted
Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: During an attempt to recover gold from the the RMS Republic, a panicking diver has an accident that puts his life in danger and threatens to shut the mission down.

programme.title: Britain's War of Thrones: The Hundred Years War, with Dan Jones
programme.desc: Dan Jones, writer, historian and consultant on Knightfall, continues his exploration of the Hundred Years War, recalling the epic story of the rival dynasties that forged the history of medieval and early modern Europe.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: Madness frontman Suggs and militaria expert Stephen Taylor tell the stories behind artefacts unearthed from former military sites across the UK. They also discover a tank buried in a vineyard.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Hurricane Florence brings biblical flooding to North Carolina, a magnitude 7 earthquake rocks Alaska, and a surfer crashes in Nazareâ€™s colossal waves.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: David Mitchell hosts an extended edition of the quiz from November 2018, with Andy Hamilton and Deborah Frances-White joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the comedy quiz show, in which he awards points for answers he finds most interesting. This edition sees Noel Fielding, Rhod Gilbert and Cariad Lloyd join regular panellist Alan Davies to tackle miscellaneous M-themed matters.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Josh Widdicombe, Gary Delaney, Tiffany Stevenson and Romesh Ranganathan for the comedy quiz. The panellists give their take on major news stories from July 2014 and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee thinks the twins are too young to be taught about sex at school and that their teacher Miss Anstis is too stuck up to teach it. He resolves that it is his duty as a father to teach his children everything he knows about the facts of life, discovering only when it is too late that his knowledge is somewhat limited. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Thanks to back flips and rail rides, Tim and Gendle are in BMX bike heaven. With the clock ticking it is down to Joe and the build team to construct the ultimate BMX set-up.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are sent to Bolivia, where they are challenged to travel through the rainforest and journey to the coast of Chile, driving second-hand off-road vehicles bought locally for a maximum of Â£3,500 each. Along the way, they encounter drug lords and feel the effects of altitude sickness as they negotiate the region's roads, one of which is a notoriously dangerous 40-mile mountain pass dubbed El Camino de la Muerte - the Death Road.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill. This round comes from St Patrick's Hill in Cork as competitors hope their vehicles have what it takes to clinch victory.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the international event from London's Alexandra Palace in which amateur drivers race home-made, engineers vehicles. Over the years, vehicles have ranged from a piano to a giant baby carriage, and the latest contenders include C-17 Roadmaster, Braking Badly, Poldark Express and Turbo Tugboat.

programme.title: Top Gear: Top Fails
programme.desc: A look back at all that Top Gear has tried and failed to accomplish, including spectacular fails, mixing shorter, one-off catastrophes with more developed failures.

programme.title: Top Gear: Top Fails
programme.desc: A look back at all that Top Gear has tried and failed to accomplish, including spectacular fails, mixing shorter, one-off catastrophes with longer, more developed failures.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The conclusion of the two-part special in which Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May take three used, V8-engined sports cars on a gruelling road trip covering 1,600 miles through Patagonia to the world's southernmost city. Having encountered stunning landscapes, mechanical mishaps and dreadful roads on their journey through Argentina, the trio's adventure is brought to a dramatic climax by a terrifying turn of events.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Sixty teams take on a very quick course down Windhaven Parkway in Fort Worth. Who will triumph in the Lone Star State?.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: An extraordinary Red Bull Soapbox course at the Yomiuriland Amusement Park in Tokyo. The course includes a unique see-saw feature and a wicked berm.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The posse meet three cat clerics who worship Lister. Lister vows to help them as they're being hunted by a feral cat leader who wants to wipe out cats who worship anyone but him. Ray Fearon joins the regular cast as the ruthless Rodon, leader of the feral cats, with Tom Bennett, Mandeep Dhillon and Lucy Pearman as the cat clerics.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the comedy quiz show, in which he awards points for answers he finds most interesting. This edition sees Noel Fielding, Rhod Gilbert and Cariad Lloyd join regular panellist Alan Davies to tackle miscellaneous M-themed matters.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Rob Beckett, Jen Brister, Darren Harriott
programme.desc: Stand-up comedian Rob Beckett plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He warms up the audience and then introduces routines by rising comedy stars Jen Brister and Darren Harriott.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Ed Byrne, Milton Jones, Russell Kane and Zoe Lyons on the comedy quiz. The panellists give their take on the major news stories from July 2014 and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Lorraine Kelly and Dara O Briain join David Mitchell's team while Barry Cryer and Sue Perkins are captained by Lee Mack, on the panel game where contestants try to fool their opponents into mistaking fact for fiction and vice versa. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Chinese authorities attempt a huge infrastructure project as they try to move vast amounts of water from the wet south of the country to the dry north.

programme.title: Jim Clark: The Quiet Champion
programme.desc: Profile of the two-time Formula One champion, who was killed at the height of his career. Featuring rare archive footage from family home-movies, candid interviews with the driver himself and comments by close friends, including Jackie Stewart, who reminisces about their time spent together racing when they were known as Batman and Robin.

programme.title: Graham Hill: Driven
programme.desc: An intimate portrait of motor racing star Graham Hill, who became the only man to win the Formula One World Championship, Indianapolis 500 and Le Mans 24-hour race - but whose reckless streak was to prove his undoing. Among those sharing their memories of the charismatic Englishman are his son Damon - who became Formula One world champion himself in 1996 - and Jackie Stewart.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: The historian follows in the footsteps of 19th-century gold prospectors, attempting to find riches in a remote region on the edge of the Canadian arctic. He is joined on his expedition by polar explorer Felicity Aston and physiologist Dr Kevin Fong. The first challenge of the trek is to cross Alaska's Coast Mountains, where they retrace two routes set by 19th-century miners and brave icy rivers, avalanche-prone slopes and near vertical ascents.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong build a wooden boat, following original designs for the vessels used during the Gold Rush. This vessel must carry them across hundreds of miles of treacherous lakes and rivers, including the infamous One Mile Rapids, a narrow canyon of white water and jagged rocks.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: Henry Ford's plan, with the help of Albert Kahn, to build a giant factory in Michigan, covering 3.5million sq ft and including an aircraft production line half a mile in length.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: The documentary uncovering the hidden history of Britain continues with the story of the department store Selfridges, looking at the ways it changed the country's shopping habits. Plus, an examination of the life of Mr Selfridge himself.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: British troops save Edith and Rene from execution, and the pair are released into the woods. Meanwhile, the Germans decide to head for Spain, and Michelle joins Crabtree in a duet. Classic wartime sitcom, starring Gorden Kaye and Carmen Silvera.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The Colonel and Gruber's escape plan has gone awry, so they try to make general Von Klinkerhoffen believe the Resistance had kidnapped them.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene is imprisoned by communist leader Louise, who plans to use him as her love slave, while Mimi, Edith and Yvette are convinced he is dead and decide to hold a seance.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Four VW camper vans pitch up at the auction house looking for a new home and Derek picks up an Austin 16 that 'goes like stink and has some unusual modern modifications'.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: A former dealer is selling his entire medal collection - will Dave and Steve find anything worth bidding for? And Steve digs deep into a WW1 army medic's family history.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: At St Athan in Wales, engineer John Sparks and his team of ex-Navy and RAF engineers begin the task of reassembling the Czech-built jet from nine parts delivered by lorry.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Lynda La Plante's crime drama. DI Pat North investigates the case of a woman abducted in broad daylight, but a sudden murder confession leaves the squad with more questions than answers. Meanwhile, DCS Michael Walker begins to fear for his children's safety at the hands of his ex-wife's new boyfriend. Kate Buffery and David Hayman star.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part two of two. The roguish antiques dealer finds a Scottish gothic temple brings him closer to Lady Jane, while love is in the air for Eric. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: DI Morell investigates Honey's apparent abduction by new husband Scott, little suspecting she has fled with him of her own volition and is preparing to set sail for France. Unfortunately, he blurts out a confession of his guilt as they're waiting for the boat to arrive, leaving her facing the uncomfortable realisation that she's trapped with a murderer. Back at Sun Hill, Yvonne leaves herself open to charges of using excessive force to detain a suspect and Amber teases Dan Casper about his alleged run-in with a gang of armed youths.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Honey is interviewed by Adam and fights to save her career, insisting she was abducted by new husband Scott. JT begins to suspect Gina has cancer, and Dan alleges Amber has been blackmailing him to do menial duties on her behalf, while Yvonne is devastated to learn Lee Thomas, the young thug she forcibly restrained at the cemetery, has died of his injuries.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of three. Yvonne is suspended from duty pending further investigation into the death of young thug Lee Thomas, and Leela is also accused of assaulting a suspect, leaving the relief uncertain as to what constitutes reasonable force when making an arrest. Fearful of leaving himself open to accusations of heavy-handedness or police brutality, Tony later hesitates to use force in a confrontation with local youths - and suffers a horrific beating. Meanwhile Zain Nadir agrees to do a stint in CID before beginning his next undercover job.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of three. As Tony recovers in hospital, Gabriel and Roger are disciplined for using their CS spray in a tense situation, prompting June to stand up for coppers' rights and call the demoralised relief out on strike. Unfortunately for Lance, he's already been dragged out on an unauthorised mission by Zain Nadir, and ends up being held at gunpoint by a local gangster. On the personal front, Phil receives the shocking news that Kate Maltby has been rushed to hospital and might lose their baby, while Dan receives a letter in the internal mail from someone who clearly knows about his affair with Sun Hill newcomer Rochelle Barratt.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A young nun is found dead in a smoke-filled bedroom in what seems like a terrible accident caused by a lit cigarette. But when Richard deduces it must have been murder, there are no shortage of suspects, including other nuns, a priest and the mother superior - as well as an unscrupulous PR man promoting a holy spring in the convent grounds. The question is, with the room locked from the inside, how could anyone have committed the crime in the first place? Kenneth Cranham, Patrick Baladi and Caroline Langrishe guest star.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A body is discovered floating in the pool of an exclusive cosmetic surgery clinic and several things point to suicide - the victim was going through a messy divorce and there is an empty pill box in her room. But DI Poole has several reasons to believe Valerie Dupree was murdered - not least the fact she poured herself a cup of the world's most expensive tea but only drank half. The pressure is on to find the culprit as the clinic is highly respected on the island and the chief surgeon is an old friend of Commissioner Patterson - and as the detectives begin to dig, they discover many sordid secrets among the guests and staff. Cherie Lunghi (Secret Diary of a Call Girl), James Fleet (The Vicar of Dibley) and Emma Pierson (Hotel Babylon) guest star.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Treasure hunters arrive on the island to track down the loot of a legendary pirate, a search that comes to an abrupt halt when the party's geologist is shot dead in leader Daniel Morgan's tent. As the murder weapon was a 300-year-old pistol, DI Poole decides every member of the team is a suspect - but the investigation takes a strange turn when Daniel falls victim to a series of unfortunate and coincidental accidents. Has a mythical pirate's curse become a reality or is someone from the 21st century simply trying to bump him off? Ben Miller and Sara Martins star, with Michael Brandon (Dempsey and Makepeace) and Kelly Adams (Hustle).

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner and Shelagh are at the forefront of the advances in medical technology, and begin a campaign to ensure better respiratory health for their patients. However, Timothy fears their own lifestyle is not good for them and tries to encourage his parents to give up smoking. Violet injures her back and is forced to leave the shop in Fred's hands, a decision that strengthens their relationship but which proves to have other, unforeseen consequences. A new mother's past comes to light, with devastating repercussions for her family. Nurse Crane draws on her own experiences to help her.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Poplar is rocked by a series of violent attacks on women, and a prostitute is too ashamed to report what she knows - but her actions lead to a dangerous man roaming the streets, with devastating consequences for the residents of Nonnatus House. A mother tries to keep her daughter's pregnancy a secret to avoid gossip, putting her life in danger. The Turners go on a long overdue holiday, but the weather ruins their plans.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The introduction of the contraceptive pill is welcomed by Dr Turner, but some of his colleagues are less keen on the idea. Patsy tries to help a bargee who wants to give birth among her own community rather than in a maternity ward. Nurse Crane deals with an emergency during a storm, and a familiar face returns to Nonnatus House - but has been changed by her time away.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner is horrified to realise he may be partly to blame as the cause of the recent rise in birth deformities comes to light, and tries to prevent further cases. Sister Evangelina returns to work, but has clearly been affected badly by her stroke, and her health continues to deteriorate. A pregnant bride goes into labour during her wedding reception, while her mother is forced to come to terms with her grandchild being conceived out of wedlock.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Christmas special of the period drama, which catches up with the nurses and midwives of Nonnatus House in 1962. They receive a letter from a doctor running a mission clinic on the Eastern Cape of South Africa, who is in desperate need of their help to save her urgently needed hospital from closure. The nurses head to Africa to lend a hand, finding the clinic understaffed, underfunded and with a poor water supply, but overwhelmed with patients who need their help more than anyone ever has before. Sinead Cusack guest stars.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Kristin, Breen and Gina witness a fatal skydiving accident while celebrating Mike's birthday with a picnic. To make matters worse, Kristin knows the victim - entrepreneur Andre Barrington, an ex-boyfriend. When the cords are found severed, it becomes clear that his demise was either suicide or murder.

programme.title: Lady Chatterley
programme.desc: Connie's marriage begins to fall apart, so she flees to her father's seaside retreat. But before she leaves, she must fulfil her promise to Mellors of one last night together. Starring Joely Richardson and Sean Bean.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Babushka
programme.desc: Game show in which contestants answer questions to get the chance to open a set of giant Russian nesting dolls, with some empty and others containing prizes up to Â£10,000. Rylan Clark-Neal asks the questions.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Can Danny handle the pressure of performing basketball tricks in front of hundreds of fans and avoid the messy forfeit?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: In the desert, Fizz and Weasel plan a fireworks display for Fizz. Mountain Rescuer Magoo mistakes Weasel for a skier in distress..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: In the forest, Magoo sets up camp by the rare fruit patch, giving a warm welcome to a bear that he has mistaken for a wayward hiker..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he's a beach lifeguard but is actually on an ice floe and the swimmers are penguins..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket is selling up and moving on... but what will happen to Mr. Bean?.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean takes on the Bruisers at the local skateboard park, using only a mobility scooter..

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: During a tour of the Japanese Robotics Museum, Ben finds hero-gone-wrong Tim Buktu 'trying to save' Tokyo from a Dragon.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Dreadful Debacle of DJ Drowsy Drawers
programme.desc: George and Harold are trapped at the school dance, so they decide to play a prank on Ms Hurd..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Betty wants a nice photo of Dave and Anna, but the camera George uses happens to belong to Gran, and it's been cursed by an ancient mummy..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: If there were two things Dave could wish for it would be for Fuzzypeg to smell better, and for Gran to be nicer. Is getting what you want always a good thing?.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by friend and Michelin-starred chef Mark Jordan, riding around Jersey on mini motorbikes while exploring the island's culinary delights. James samples one of Jersey's most famous exports - the Jersey Royal potato - which he uses to cook up a squid risotto with a difference. Mark gets a lesson in oyster shucking and James uses Jersey black butter to create a black butter tartlet.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's tour of Sardinia continues in the Nuoro region, where his guide Claudio takes him to meet his parents, who run a small bakery specialising in pane carasau, a thin crispy bread found all over the island. Claudio then takes the chef to his family's citrus farm to discover local fruit the pompia, a citrus so bitter it is never eaten raw but makes a fabulous liqueur. Moving up to the hills, Ainsley cooks a traditional sheep stew with a group of shepherds, visits one of the island's ancient archaeological sites and cooks up a Sardinian-style minestrone.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner make a chocolate cake out of leftover Easter eggs, and provide recipes for lamb fritters and scrambled eggs. Gino D'Acampo cooks seabass in Sardinia, Levi Roots makes spicy roast lamb, and The Great British Bake Off's Jane Beedle demonstrates cherry and pistachio tart.

programme.title: Griff's Great Australian Adventure
programme.sub-title: Spirit of Queensland: Brisbane to Cairns
programme.desc: Comedian, actor and travel enthusiast Griff Rhys Jones journeys from Brisbane to Cairns aboard the Spirit of Queensland railway - and during his various stops, he comes across all manner of things that seem determined to kill him, from jellyfish to dingoes to whitewater rapids and more.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of the nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win a huge cash prize and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams make up the judging panel, looking for performers worthy of the Golden Buzzer and a slot in the semi-finals.

programme.title: Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory (1971)
programme.desc: An eccentric confectionery king announces that five children will be given a tour of his wondrous factory. The winners turn out to be a kind-hearted boy from a penniless family and four obnoxious brats, who face a terrible fate when they misbehave. Musical fantasy, based on Roald Dahl's classic book Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, starring Gene Wilder, Jack Albertson, Peter Ostrum and Roy Kinnear.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites Good Morning Britain host Kate Garraway, fashion presenter Gok Wan and former Mrs Brown's Boys star Rory Cowan to take part in the quiz show, answering questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of playing for the Â£20,000 jackpot prize.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Toyah Willcox, John Barnes, Germaine Greer and Audley Harrison pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.sub-title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Singer and presenter Charlotte Church, Pointless co-host Richard Osman and footballer-turned-pundit John Barnes take their turns at answering the 15 questions that could bag them Â£1million for their chosen charities. As always, if they get stuck, they have four lifelines to fall back on - Ask the Audience, 50/50, Phone a Friend and Ask the Host. Jeremy Clarkson asks the questions.

programme.title: The Good Karma Hospital
programme.desc: Lydia tries to help a mysterious runaway teenager in the chaos of Diwali. Gabriel and Aisha bond over their past when they are thrown together in a clinic. Ted's search reveals new surprises about the mark he left on India and Jyoti discharges herself - but is she ready to go home? Medical drama, starring Amanda Redman, James Krishna Floyd, Priyanka Bose, Kenneth Cranham and Sayani Gupta.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: A revelation about Charles' past spells disaster for John and jeopardises his entire future. He must act fast to keep the explosive information hidden from those who could use it to ruin his prospects. Anne receives a visit from a former employee, giving Ellis an idea of how to make some money - but she is not as cunning as she thinks. Oliver visits the mill in his search for ammunition to use against Charles, and Lady Templemore stands firm on her plans for Maria's upcoming engagement, meaning the young woman must take matters into her own hands.

programme.title: Secrets of the Driving Test
programme.desc: Cameras capture more would-be drivers as they sit their driving tests. Fifty-six-year-old Julie is desperate to pass on her third attempt, even though she has not driven in more than 24 years, while make-up artist Bradley serenades his driving examiner. In Hull, fiercely competitive father and daughter duo Rich and Yalana have their tests on the same day. Who will triumph? Narrated by Alan Carr.

programme.title: The Trouble with Maggie Cole
programme.desc: As the drama concludes, Roxanna is terrified by Alex's behaviour the previous night, and tries desperately to get to Alex before he confronts the money lenders. Meanwhile, Jill is still feeling shaken after witnessing Peter and Karen kissing and wonders if she should tell Maggie what has happened. As everyone gathers for the village celebrations, a sudden shocking series of events are put in motion that could potentially cost the life of one beloved villager. Starring Dawn French, Mark Heap and Gwyneth Keyworth.

programme.title: St Davids - Britain's Smallest City
programme.desc: Forager Julia scours the shoreline for seaweed for her sustainable soaps, the bug farm hosts its summer fair and the residents of Britain's smallest city celebrate the end of the busy summer season at farmer Gerald's harvest party.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.sub-title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Singer and presenter Charlotte Church, Pointless co-host Richard Osman and footballer-turned-pundit John Barnes take their turns at answering the 15 questions that could bag them Â£1million for their chosen charities. As always, if they get stuck, they have four lifelines to fall back on - Ask the Audience, 50/50, Phone a Friend and Ask the Host. Jeremy Clarkson asks the questions.

programme.title: World's Deepest Goldmine
programme.desc: South Africa's Mponeng mine reaches 3,500km into the ground, but its gold reserves are almost exhausted. This documentary questions whether the risks posed to the underground workers justify burying even deeper into the Earth.

programme.title: King Tut's Mystery Tomb Opened
programme.desc: Egyptologist Otto Schaden and a team of archaeologists continue their excavations of a burial chamber in the necropolis used by the pharaohs beneath Egypt's legendary Valley of the Kings, a tomb known only as KV63.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The team works on a bike for Gladiator Garageworks, while Mikey performs his comedy act live, Paul Jr appears on Adam Carolla's podcast, and Paul Sr shares news about a loved one.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Ken and Danny race to beat rival repo men on a yacht heist, while Mike finds himself in a high stakes game of 'chicken' between a jet and a Lamborghini.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe joins a team trying to catch wild chickens on the streets of Miami - and discovers the birds can be highly cunning adversaries.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Mountain Bike Suspensions/Surgical Sutures/Grain Dryers/Frying Pans
programme.desc: The documentary explores the design and production of mountain bike suspensions, surgical sutures, grain dryers and frying pans.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Ski Bindings/Immersion Parts Washers/ Mine Ventilation/Pencil Sharpeners
programme.desc: The development and manufacturing processes behind the creation of downhill ski bindings, immersion parts washers, mining ventilation equipment, and pencil sharpeners.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Bitesize
programme.desc: Drew and Tee head to Belgium in search of continental treasures, visiting one of Europe's biggest flea markets before meeting a world-famous dealer with a host of items..

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Experts try to restore family heirlooms and treasured possessions to their former glory in time for Christmas. Among the items is a Victorian version of a jukebox called a Polyphon, that has rusted into silence. It moves sisters Ann and Kathryn to tears when they hear it play the family's favourite carol for the first time in decades.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Restorers get to work on a grandfather clock, hoping to make it chime again, and doctors perform surgery on a teddy bear with only one ear and one arm after a run-in with a puppy.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A 100-year-old Nordic rocking chair that its owner's grandparents were given on their wedding day is restored. A mother of pearl shell and a ceramic bulldog are also redeemed.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts take on the challenges of restoring three cherished family heirlooms, bringing back to life a Victorian cuckoo clock, a 1970s bowl and a 200-year-old sea chest.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Painting conservator Lucia Scalisi faces a serious challenge when presented with a perforated painting by celebrated British artist Fred Appleyard.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Metal worker Dominic Chinea has to use all of his restoration skills to future proof an old, Cornish museum sign, while Steven Fletcher has to steer an old banger back onto the road. Plus, bear-care team Julie and Amanda start treatment on George, a very special teddy who has lost one of his eyes and his growl.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A barometer, rowing oars that could have a hidden past and a pinball machine that has spent the last few years being used as a kitchen worktop are restored.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A toy boat, a vintage gramophone and a doll suffering the effects of years of love and affection are restored by the experts.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restore a broken hand mirror containing the portrait of a mysterious French lady, and a painting of fog on the river Thames is also repaired.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Steve Fletcher brings a German-made toy steam roller from the 1930s back to life, and Matthew Nickels pieces together a damaged glass picture window.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Cabinet-maker Alex resurrects a once-stunning 300-year-old chest that's only fit for firewood. Plus, taxidermist Chris is challenged to resuscitate a Victorian heron.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Cabinet maker Alex repairs a battered chest that once belonged to a secretive Masonic lodge. Blacksmith Nev uses his skills to restore some historic street lamps.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Fine art sculptor Nick must be extra careful as he uses a drill to restore a 19th-century urn. Lighting specialist Jolene is challenged by Drew to repair a funfair display.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Sculptor Nick has his skills stretched by an equestrian piece with classical connections. Plus, leather expert Martin works on a piece of luggage once owned by Russian royalty.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Part two of two. The team finishes the build of the ultimate Mustang Sleeper. Plus, Phil wants a 1949 Chevy Pick-up, but the truck is a disassembled jigsaw puzzle.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: On a 100-acre property in Arkansas, Mike Wolfe falls hard for a midget race car with a Knucklehead motor and prize-winning pedigree.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restore a broken hand mirror containing the portrait of a mysterious French lady, and a painting of fog on the river Thames is also repaired.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a giant mid-Wales market, Drew Pritchard has the pick of over 1,000 stalls showcasing world-class pieces. He spies a 200-year-old Windsor chair in the best condition he's ever seen.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado, Drew Pritchard teams up with Paul Cowland for a motoring mission, scouring the UK, buying, restoring and selling classic cars.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Swansea, a huge barge is ripped apart. Meanwhile, in London, six tower blocks are demolished and on the south coast, scrap queens search for valuable scrap material.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: After finding evidence of a 1700s-era lifeboat near shore, Darrell and the team discover the shipwreck it came from, but a sudden tragedy hits the expedition.

programme.title: Top 10 Mysteries and Conspiracies
programme.desc: The enigmatic events and unexplained phenomena that have piqued curiosity throughout history, culminating in the number one mystery and conspiracy of all time.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Scientific methods of solving crimes, sometimes centuries after they were committed.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: Unspeakable crimes solved with the help of CCTV, focusing on the case of two Florida parents brutally gunned down. Investigators had to rely on surveillance cameras to catch the killers and bring them to justice.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case from Oklahoma, where the Long Branch Saloon was the local hangout for many in the small town of Poteau. However, its beloved proprietor Joe Neff went missing in 2009, leaving behind a splatter of blood. His body was later retrieved from an old mining strip pit, but the identity of his killer remained a mystery.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Examining a murder investigation in which police turned to the FBI's crime laboratory after encountering difficulties in identifying a woman's body.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The SPCA seizes a hoard of sick animals, including several roosters, a goat and a pregnant cat. Plus, investigator Scott Wernick confiscates numerous dogs that have been left to fend for themselves.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown turns his attention to an amorous rabbit, a malnourished platypus and a pet that has escaped multiple times.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride Kristy wants to look like a pirate at her wedding, while Laura's father does not shy away from voicing his ideas on the perfect dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.sub-title: A Tale of Two Bridesmaids' Dresses
programme.desc: Bride Julie is fighting with her party because she wants two different dresses - one for bridesmaids and one for the honorary bridesmaids.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori does not normally allow men in her salon, but when a group of brides ignore her and the lads start to cause chaos, her team must take control.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride-to-be who has planned a fairy-themed wedding hopes to find a dress to match. Plus, Vicki returns for a fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: All brides have a tight budget, forcing some to haggle for even more bang for their buck. It remains to be seen whether everyone will be able to secure their dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Consultant Sarah becomes engaged and looks for a dress of her own, while Sola searches for a gown that will reflect her culture.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Carmel is assigned to help a bride-to-be who is preparing a military wedding, but Randy steps in instead. Plus, a client searches for a dress to renew her vows in.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Alex needs to find out what is wrong with a dog struggling with a heatwave. A pregnant guinea pig is being watched closely, while Dr Kate helps a baby wombat.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown meets a cormorant missing half its beak, and practice makes perfect for some budding vets. A dog has a hip problem - and there is only one way to fix it.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 22-year-old Bradyn Fuksa, who vanished in July 2009 after taking a mysterious 10-hour journey from Kansas to Wyoming before abandoning his vehicle.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Tanya Rider, who disappeared in September 2007 on her way home from work in Maple Valley, Washington. Barely alive, she was discovered eight days later at the bottom of a steep ravine inside her wrecked car.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Idaho roofer and avid hunter Jeramy Burt, who vanished in February 2007 shortly after telling his ex-wife he intended to seek a new life. Several months later, his car was found torched in a remote desert, but he had taken no other personal items with him other than his mobile phone.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Summer and Joseph McStay, who vanished from their home San Diego, California, with their two children in February 2010, leaving their pets and possessions behind. It transpired the pair were being chased by various debt collection agents and CCTV footage suggested they had crossed into Mexico. Subsequent to this documentary's first airing, their bodies were recovered from a shallow grave in the Californian desert, though the identity of their killers remains unknown.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Diana is a prisoner to her 620lb-body. Desperate to break free of her food addiction, she embarks on a weight loss journey, hoping to keep her food addiction in check, in order to regain control of her life.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A woman with a childhood history of abuse followed in her mother's footsteps in overeating for protection, but is now trying to lose weight to save her life.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A 23-year-old man who overeats to cope with memories of his traumatic childhood loses his support network, and must find a new way to regain control of his life.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa performs readings for Grammy and Oscar winner Melissa Etheridge, and actor Titus Burgess, and meets talk-show host Marilu Henner for a reading.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: A man must conquer his cockroach infestation and clear out his hoard or face having his home condemned.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: A case in which a teenage couple disappeared from a Colorado neighbourhood in the middle of winter. Their car turned up abandoned and burnt in a field. The spring thaw revealed a hideous truth that shocked the community.

programme.title: 1000lb Sisters
programme.desc: The Slaton sisters rely on each other and food for support. Amy, 31, wants to have children, but is unable to due to her weight. Tammy, 32, is almost bedridden.

programme.title: The World's Fattest Man - A Love Story
programme.desc: The former 'World's Fattest Man' Paul Mason seeks a surgeon to remove the excess skin after his 700lbs weight loss. As he struggles through his weight-loss journey, he finds love.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Photographic evidence captured by forensic experts who are the first to the scene of a crime.
